content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Compare prices for economy class round-trip flights from Dubai to Rome, departing on May 1, 2026, and returning on May 8, 2026, and select the option with the fewest stops.  Please interact with https://www.google.com/travel/flights/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To start searching for flights from Dubai to Rome, I need to input "Dubai" in the "Where from?" field.
Action: Type [13]; Dubai
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Where from?" field is now set to "Dubai." Next, I should enter "Rome" in the "Where to?" field to continue setting up the flight search.
Action: Type [14]; Rome
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: "Dubai" is correctly set as the origin and "Rome" as the destination. Next, I need to input the departure date (May 1, 2026) to match the task requirements.
Action: Type [16]; 2026-05-01
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar selector shows that May 1, 2026 (price: $737) is selected as the departure date. The next step is to select May 8, 2026 as the return date to match the round-trip criteria in the task.
Action: Click [54]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar currently has June 8, 2026 selected as the return date, but the required date is May 8, 2026. I need to select May 8, 2026 as the return date to match the round-trip criteria.
Action: Click [24]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar currently has May 9, 2026 selected as the return date, but the task requires May 8, 2026. I need to select May 8, 2026 for the return.
Action: Click [23]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: May 8, 2026 is now correctly selected as the return date. The next step is to confirm the date selection so that the flight results can be generated.
Action: Click [79]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: All the flight search criteria are set: round trip, economy, Dubai to Rome, departing May 1, returning May 8, 2026. The next step is to search for available flights.
Action: Click [20]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is being shown again. I likely need to confirm the selected dates (May 1, 2026 for departure and May 8, 2026 for return) to proceed to the flight results page.
Action: Click [81]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The date selector has closed and the main search form is visible again. To display flight search results based on the entered information, I need to click the search button.
Action: Click [20]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The site has reverted to the calendar selection screen, likely because the return date was not correctly set. Both May 1 (depart) and May 8 (return) need to be explicitly selected and confirmed to make sure the search runs for the correct dates.
Action: Click [23] 
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Both the departure (May 1) and return date (May 8) are now clearly selected. To make Google Flights search for flights on these dates, I should now confirm this selection by clicking "Done."
Action: Click [79]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.95
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: All the search criteria are correctly set: round trip, economy, Dubai to Rome, departing May 1, 2026, and returning May 8, 2026. To view and compare flight options, I need to click the "Search" button.
Action: Click [20]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.97
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar has reappeared with May 1 as the default selection, but May 8 is currently selected as a one-way trip. I need to confirm round-trip by choosing the return date and clicking "Done" to proceed to flight results.
Action: Click [23] 
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.97
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Both the departure (May 1) and return (May 8) dates are now selected. It's time to confirm the selection and see the actual flight results.
Action: Click [79]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.99
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search criteria include Dubai to Rome, May 8 set as departure, but the return date is missing. I need to reselect the correct round-trip dates (May 1 departure, May 8 return) and click "Search" to get relevant flight options.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.98
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is displayed. May 8 is selected as departure, but I need a return date (May 8 is not correct; departure should be May 1, return May 8). I should select May 1, 2026 as departure, then confirm.
Action: Click [47]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.98

Thought: The current selection is May 8 as departure and June 1 as return. To correct this, I need to pick May 1, 2026 as departure and May 8, 2026 as return to match the task requirement.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.98

Thought: The calendar now has May 1, 2026 as the departure date but the return date is set to June 1, 2026. I need to select May 8, 2026 as the return date to match the task requirements.
Action: Click [24]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.99

Thought: The current selection is May 1, 2026 as departure and May 7, 2026 as return. I need to select May 8, 2026 (element [25]) as the correct return date according to the task instructions.
Action: Click [25]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.99
